text: hello everyone
Anthony Fantana here internets busiest
music nerd and it's time for your review
purity ring shrines purity ring is a duo
consisting of megan james vocalist and
and i assume just on the production and
this is the debut LP from this synth pop
project that caused quite a stir with
some ethereal adorable singles one of
which belly's peak was one of my
favorite singles of last year and both
of those singles from 2011 have made it
onto this new LP and the remaining nine
tracks on this album pretty much follow
the stylistic suit set by those singles
now purity ring's approach to
synthesizer pop is pretty familiar but
still different enough to kind of be
worth buzzing about without I guess kind
of reading it three months from now the
songs on this thing feature very heavy
atmospheric slow-paced synthesizers and
very spacious beats that take a lot of
cues from chopped and screwed style hip
hop production as well as some southern
hip hop - with very kind of trap style
snares and hi-hats rattling throughout a
lot of these tracks but the songs
overall do not come off as dark as I
guess you would assume given that those
two things are pretty much in every song
and the reason the songs on here aren't
really brooding it is Megan James voice
keeps purity ring's songs from just
going too deep into the abyss Megan's
voice has a very kind of childlike
tambour to it it feels very young feels
very girly even on a more sensitive
track on this album cartography Megan's
voice still maintains a kind of I guess
cutesy quality to it I feel like her
does bring a somewhat I guess unique
sound to pure earring style but is kind
of a double-edged sword for me the
vocals can be a little monotonous
one-dimensional Meghan's range is not
all that far and most of her vocal
melodies tend to kind of sound very say
me say me and emotionally I feel like
many of her vocal deliveries on these
tracks are pretty flat too very kind of
disengaged and and repetitive in that
way it kind of reminds me of like a JJ
album and instrumentally I don't really
feel like purity ring has developed its
style all that well past the handful of
singles that have been released before
this LP the singles have the most
detailed production unique melodies and
catchiest hooks but it's not just that
because of that one-dimensional quality
that I feel like this album has
listening to an entire gauntlet of songs
from purity ring does feel a little
boring to me it kind of reminds me of
that Colts album that got released last
year they had songs released prior to
that LP the year before that I thought
were pretty good but then sitting
through an entire album of their
material really just did not do it for
me I'm sure they share some fans as well
but I'm kind of you know digressing at
this point purity ring definitely has a
more original style and if we can take
the the label which house seriously for
one second I think they are more
enjoyable and better produce than most
of the artists who kind of get slapped
with that pretty fashionable label I
feel like there's a lot to like about
the style that purity ring's has going
on shrines but the execution the
performance of the songs on this LP is
just really underwhelming and the
songwriting can be kind of hit or miss
like the song fine shrine which has some
very glossy since a sputtering beat that
I like as well as some kind of morbid
lyrics that I'm enjoying but the
repetitive melodies and just the lack of
added details as the song progresses
just
don't really sit well with me plus the
song a lot of songs on here just overall
feel pretty lethargic and not in an
intoxicating way there are some sharp
tunes on this album but just not enough
to really make me like the whole thing I
think overall pure d-ring really kind of
values style over songs and execution
I'm very on the fence with this LP kind
of feeling a strong five to a light six
on it did you guys like it hate it why
let me know and remember the good
comment the great rate and only the
strong subscribe Anthony Fantana purity
ring shrines forever
[Music]
[Music]
